attributes.action: Make child parking legally badge-held spaces only for those with children.
attributes.background: People are using these spaces without children present causing undue stress and danger to those with a child or children present. We are punished for parking illegally in disabled slots. Why is children parking any different...

attributes.action: Stop Parliamentary recess for Party Annual Conferences
attributes.background: I passionately believe the Parliament of the United Kingdom fails to serve the country efficiently as it is 'closed' too often and for excessive periods. If Party Conferences are necessary they should be held during summer recess or another recess period.

attributes.action: Legalise a new class of light electric vehicles
attributes.background: Living in a big city, getting around is a major consideration. Public transport is overcrowded, dirty and often inconvenient. Private vehicles are unaffordable and inconvenient. As the UK invests in infrastructure for the alternative, cycling, PEVs which could utilise this continue to be outlawed.
attributes.additional_details:
As many other countries already do, the UK should embrace the existence of Personal Electric Vehicles (PEVs).

These are small electrically propelled vehicles such as scooters which reach similar speeds to a bicycle with a range of around 20 miles, and unlike bikes are practical enough to be handled like a suitcase when not in use.

With similar regards to electric bikes, legalising PEVs will offer an added green alternative for transportation and allow individuals improved freedom of movement.

attributes.action: Extend the remit of Employment Tribunals to include all equality-related cases
attributes.background: Employment Tribunals should become Employment & Equality Tribunals and hear all equality-related cases. Why have an Equality Act if only employees have access to legal redress? The Government must ensure that everyone, including pensioners and students, has equal access to justice at equal cost.
attributes.additional_details: The additional burden on the tribunal system would be small compared with the huge difference the change would make to those suffering breaches of the law. If the government won't extend the remit, they must explain why disabled students have fewer rights than disabled employees. An employee with a discrimination claim can go to the tribunal, but if someone other than their employer discriminates against them, they have to file an expensive claim in the County Court or the High Court.

attributes.action: No military action in Syria until perpetrators of chemical attacks are verified.
attributes.background: Involvement in missile strikes or other military action against the Syrian government will escalate the conflict, resulting in yet greater loss of life. Please hold back until we know more.

attributes.action: Record homeless death statistics at local and national levels
attributes.background: According to the guardian, the number of homeless deaths on Britain’s streets has more than doubled since 2013, yet the extent of the problem is not known as neither the government nor local authorities are required to keep statistics on this. By understanding the problem, it can be better tackled.
attributes.additional_details: On 11 April 2018, Patrick Greenfield and Sarah Marsh wrote in the guardian that the number of homeless people dying on the streets of Britain has more than doubled in recent years, but the true extent of the problem could be much higher as there is no national or locally recorded official statistics measuring this. To better understand and help to tackle this issue, statistics on the number of deaths of homeless people on the streets of Britain should be recorded.

attributes.action: Create regulatory body to set the standards and ethics of AI development.
attributes.background: Working under the acronym OF-AIR - Office of AI Regulation, this organisation would utilise respected minds across areas such as Ethical Philosophy, Law and Technology to regulate the means and use of AI across technological sectors to prevent industrial monopoly or unethical development.
attributes.additional_details: From self driving cars or platooning vehicles, to corrupt algorithms manipulating politics and ultimately the ability to create robots that can 'think for themselves', what was once the realms of Science Fiction is now upon us as a reality and should be controlled to prevent corruption across both industry and individuals and to mitigate political and unlawful gain.

attributes.action: Debate harmful effects of Balloon releasing.
attributes.background: Plastic in the seas is becoming more widely known. Releasing balloons is harmful to the environment, affecting land animals, sea mammals, creatures and is eventually ingested by fish. Research has found it is consumed by humans and pets via micro-plastics. Beaches are littered with enough rubbish.

attributes.action: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +
attributes.background: Raise awareness of endometriosis, for all women 18 to 60 +,men if they know women who are effected. for delivery within professional and public services such as doctors, women's health clinics, to raise awareness of issues faced, treatment by doctors and early detection.
attributes.additional_details: is is important to gain a better understanding of the long term costs and implications to health of those who are effected, awareness of the amount of women affected, hereditary implications and risks associated such as forced hysterectomies, major surgeries and the long term implications to finances and employment of those concerned due to pain and discomfort of symptoms.

attributes.action: Mandate to install standard microfiber filters in washing machines
attributes.background: Around 700,000 microscopic fibres could be released into waste water during each use of a domestic washing machine.These microfibres act as sponges to toxic chemicals known to cause cancer etc. They end up in Fish/ Sea Salt/Tap&Bottled water where they release these chemicals & may become lethal
attributes.additional_details:
The current filters in the washing machines are not capable enough to filter these microfibers and this leak can be stopped, if we mandate installation of standard microfiber filters

1. The Hidden Plastic In Our Dinner: http://bit.ly/2FeK5YJ 
2. https://www.plymouth.ac.uk/news/washing-clothes-releases-thousands-of-microplastic-particles-into-environment-study-shows
3. https://www.theguardian.com/environment/2017/nov/28/stella-mccartney-calls-for-overhaul-of-incredibly-wasteful-fashion-industry
4. http://www.thethamesproject.org/dangers-microfibres-microplastics/

attributes.action: Create a scheme that encourages those receiving state benefits to litter pick
attributes.background: As we know from recent media attention, litter is blighting our country and wildlife, and the only way to clear it up is to pick it up. The scheme would not only do this, but also give participants a sense of achievement and responsibility, perhaps encouraged by a reward.
attributes.additional_details: Further consideration should be made for the armed forces, whilst not engaged in military action, to contribute manpower to the scheme.

attributes.action: Ban positive action in organisations and have all candidates treated equally.
attributes.background: Positive action is unfair. For example, a wealthy female will have an advantage over a less affluent male when it comes to recruitment. No organisation should ask for race, religion, gender or sexuality. This is not relevant to the job and results in less effective recruitment UK wide.
attributes.additional_details: Companies and government organisations should be concerned with finding the best, regardless of non-relevant issues such as a persons sexuality. Employers should be blind when it comes to who gets through to assessment centres and interviews. It’s not fair that suddenly every white male is considered as having being born with a silver spoon. It’s also not fair to treat minorities and women as though they need an advantage in the recruitment process as they couldn’t get the job on their merit

attributes.action: Require schools to start at 9:30 and end at 3:30.
attributes.background: Children find it extremely difficult to wake up at 7:30 and get to school by 8 or 8:30. Most children hate coming to school because of the time you have to wake up. An extra hour of sleep helps retain information and helps the child perform better at school.
attributes.additional_details: Starting school at 9:30 and ending it at 3:30 gives us 6 hours of education where students are actually awake in lessons because they have had enough time to sleep.

attributes.action: Legally enforce an opt-out solution for paper publications sent by organisations
attributes.background: Universities, schools, and professional bodies frequently post paper journals and other publications to their members. These are usually unsolicited, and often thrown away unread. In the era of online technology, they are a waste of public and private money, and needlessly damage the environment.
attributes.additional_details: It would be very simple to create a central website (one could be built at very little expense), to which these large organisations must have a log in.  Individuals could then record their wish to unsubscribe from monthly paper publications (by organisation): expressing their mailing frequency preference, or requesting online issues instead.  The government should compel these organisations to have a membership to this system, and to respect the preferences of those receiving these publications.

attributes.action: Protect consumers who order goods that are out of stock at the time.
attributes.background: Consumers currently have the right to a refund if unhappy with goods purchased online. They should have the same right when purchasing goods in a shop where the goods are out of stock at time of purchase; as with an Internet purchase, the consumer can't inspect the goods until they actually arrive.
attributes.additional_details: In the face-to-face scenario, it can happen that the goods are out of stock, the trader asks for payment prior to ordering the goods into stock, the trader receives the goods into stock, the consumer inspects the goods but is unhappy with them, then the trader refuses to refund the consumer’s money, forcing the consumer to either accept the goods or alternatively a credit note that may be of no use to the consumer.  I believe that consumers should have the right to a refund in this situation.

attributes.action: Provide help for residents of Tawergha in Libya
attributes.background: There are around 35,000 people (who are an ethnic minority) who have been forced to leave their homes in the 2011 revolution by militias from Misrata. The UN-backed Tripoli Government promised their return to Tawargha on the 1st of February 2018, after 7 years of living in bad conditions.
attributes.additional_details: The militias have refused this government decision and blocked the roads to Tawergha by force. Now the people of Tawergha have built make-shift camps in Gararat Al-Gadaf which is near Bin Walid and Harawa which is near Sirte. On 5/02/2018 militias from Mistrata attacked the camp and burned some tents. On 12/02/2018 two people passed away and some children were admitted to Bin Walid hospital due to exposure to the cold. I am asking the British Government to provide assistance to these civilians.

attributes.action: Stop Penalty Charges for Driving in Bus Lanes on Bank Holidays
attributes.background: Bus time on bank holiday is same Sunday. Many local councils make money using bus lane on bank holiday. Their actions is not benefit to our society.

attributes.action: Legal Protection for children under age of 16 sending images to sexual predators
attributes.background: Police are threatening to charge children for creating and disturbing child pornography when sending images of themselves to sexual predators thats grooming real children.
attributes.additional_details:
Parents are now not willing to report online child sexual exploitation crimes because of fears teens will be arrested. Currently only chikdren under the age of 13 is protected from Child porn crimes when images are off themselves. 

Why should our children face charges because someone groomed them into sending images.

attributes.action: Increase the capacity of prisons by building 5 new prisons by 2022.
attributes.background: Throughout the UK over the last few years the increase of crime has put pressure onto prisons and the justice system. Therefore because there aren't enough spaces in prisons, criminals may get away with crimes they have committed. If more prisons are built, it will create more space for criminals.

attributes.action: Increase the number of GCSE options that schools offer
attributes.background: The choices we have for GCSE's can be very limited within schools. In my GCSE choices I only had nine other options, other than the core few. This has limited my possible learning and perhaps my future.
attributes.additional_details: The choices you have limit what is possible in the future for me and others with limited choices.

attributes.action: Make rehabilitation the main aim of a Judge when sentencing criminals.
attributes.background: In the UK, the main aim of Judges while sentencing is a mix of rehabilitation and deterrence, however, I believe that by deciding on one main aim, we could reduce reoffending rates.
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.businessinsider.com/why-norways-prison-system-is-so-successful-2014-12?international=true&r=US&IR=T 

The link above will take you to a trusted news website. The selected page is all about how the rehabilitation rates in Switzerland are lower than in America, Therefore, proving our point.

attributes.action: Reverse central government funding cuts to councils
attributes.background: Since 2010 central government has cut the funding to councils. It is planned that by 2020 funding by central government to councils will be reduced by 77%. Causing councils to have to make MORE devastating cuts to much needed services including social care, childrens services, education, and more.
attributes.additional_details: Due to the austerity cuts councils have had to make savings, and that has led to a spiraling funding problem, causing the most vulnerable to suffer, social services at crisis point, our roads in dire need of need repair and our children services and early years cut and cut again causing generational damage. It is time to realise that the decision of 2010 by Conservative/Lib Dem government is causing untold damage to the UK, and it needs to be reversed. Put the funding back into our councils.

attributes.action: British Citizens must be subject to UK taxation wherever they live in the world
attributes.background: The current system encourages high-earning individuals to leave the UK for tax purposes. This is not in the national interest.

attributes.action: Make it so any employer has to reply to job applications within a month.
attributes.background: Applying for a job and getting no reply is demoralising and can leave you unmotivated to apply for others. If you get no reply, you’re unsure if your CV is bad or if they’re ignoring your application. Therefore, employers should reply to applications within a certain amount of time.
attributes.additional_details: If you’re told that you’re not accepted, then it will help significantly more than being told nothing, as you can then build on your CV / application technique. But when you’re ignored, then you don’t know what is wrong and when it happens with every job you apply for it can seriously damage motivation to apply for more. Therefore I feel it is a right that an applicant reserves; to get a reply - wether it be a yes or no or simply that the role is now fulfilled.

attributes.action: Change the long assessment format for people with M.E, which causes them stress
attributes.background: The payment for PIP for people with ME can take up to four months and every year they answer the same questions. ME is a condition that affect someone’s whole life or it can a short term illness of fatigue.  People who have ME are not all able to travel to hospitals for assessments, change is needed
attributes.additional_details: The stress of PIP assessment I have witnessed first hand, the process is too long and to have the assessment every year is unfair. That person’s health may not be any different since the year before. PIP needs to be considered being kept and not keep changing to another system, so that these people don’t have to worry about financial issues or become ill because of the long assessments and worry.

attributes.action: Revoke Independent Schools' Charitable Status
attributes.background: Over the next 5 years the public will Subsidize £522 million in tax breaks to private schools in which 7% of the wealthy few attend. This is thanks to their status as charities. We call on the government to remove charitable status,  and thus taxpayer support,  from fee-paying schools

attributes.action: Give adoption allowance to self employed people
attributes.background:
If you are employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity pay.
If you are employed and adopting a child you are entitled to adoption pay.
If you are self employed and pregnant you are entitled to maternity allowance.
If you are self employed and adopting a child you are entitled to NOTHING!!
attributes.additional_details:
Please support people who are self employed and are wanting to provide a loving and stable home for a child in need.
The financial situation is very important in the adoption process as you need to be able to provide for a child emotionally and financially, no adoption allowance can stand in the way of prospective adoptive parents being approved.
Thank you.

attributes.action: Ban the use of sequential lighting indicators on cars; they are dangerously slow
attributes.background: Sequential lighting indicators use LEDs which expand over time to show the change of direction, these take a long time and can be distracting for other drivers.

attributes.action: Scrap the government’s plan of building HS2 and build a Hyperloop system instead
attributes.background: Instead of spending billions of pounds of taxpayer’s money on a system that will take so long to complete that it will already be antiquated, the government should invest in a Hyperloop system, reducing journey times exponentially, with speeds of up to 700mph. Manchester to London in 18 minutes!
attributes.additional_details:
http://www.telegraph.co.uk/technology/2017/08/26/britains-hyperloop-pipe-dream-meet-people-behind-uks-futuristic/

http://www.independent.co.uk/travel/news-and-advice/hyperloop-one-richard-branson-virgin-investment-london-scotland-transport-travel-fast-a7998106.html

https://hyperloop-one.com

attributes.action: Amend TUA 2016, so non-union members pay for benefits gained from Union work.
attributes.background:
Benefits negotiated by Trade unions at the workplace are enjoyed by union members & non-members alike.
e.g. Workplace offers 1% pay rise to workforce but through negotiations with trade union, an increased offer of 2.5% is agreed. Members & non-members alike are given a 2.5% pay rise as a result.
attributes.additional_details:
Union members already make financial contribution to support their union to act on their behalf however non-members receive the benefit of this rise without having made any financial contribution to the costs of the union achieving this mutually beneficially outcome.
Make non-union members pay monthly contribution, not exceeding subs paid by union members or they will receive only the 1% payrise.

attributes.action: Increase funding and awareness for public transport in the UK.
attributes.background: The UK is well known for being a modern and developed nation, but do we really do all that we can to make our country green? We are falling behind compared to many other countries. This directly affects everyone in the UK so take our country's future into your hands; sign now to have your say.

attributes.action: Build a Channel bridge between UK & France, to increase trade as we leave the EU
attributes.background: Build a Channel bridge between Britain and France to vastly increase trade between not just these two countries, but the entirety of Europe also. During uncertain times as we leave the European Union, such a project would reassure voters with increased economic confidence for the future.
attributes.additional_details: Would allow for easier access into both countries, making trade between UK and Europe much more easier.

attributes.action: Add ‘RESPECT’ to the National Curriculum from 5 years upwards. Lacking Today.
attributes.background:
Many grow up with little or no respect today, no Respect for Teachers the Police, Property and the Elderly, this is very wrong in this day and age, Some Police only Get Cheek in trying to correct their behaviour and the ones above.

At one time Churches could leave them open, today it’s a No No.
attributes.additional_details:
Many youngsters are Serious Lacking Any Respect today as is Proven, Some attack Teachers and their Assistants, Elderly getting abused and Picked on, when I was young it was Instilled into us ALL at school Never to do Anything Against the Elderly and all the above, we All Respected Them 100%, we would never have thought about causing Damage or Thefts from Churches, today some do, Not all are Bad just a Select few causing Antisocial Behaviour.

Let’s try to correct things and make the Country good

attributes.action: Help single parents into work by funding childcare for all ages during holidays
attributes.background: It is really hard for single parents to work during summer holidays due to the government not funding childcare for all ages, only funding for children under 5 if you spread you nursery hours throughout the year. It is near impossible for a single parent of children under 10 to work 30 hours a week.

attributes.action: To have a UK referendum on the colour of the UKGB passport post Brexit.
attributes.background: The government has announced that the UK will be returning to a navy blue passport post Brexit. As Brexit is about building a new future, a return to its navy origins can be considered looking backwards. There should be a choice of colours for people to choose from to represent this new beginning.
attributes.additional_details: https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Color_wheel

attributes.action: Televise Government lobby briefings
attributes.background: With trust in both politicians and the mainstream media at an all time low,  government lobby briefings should be televised to demonstrate a true record of what has taken place.
attributes.additional_details: The public are sceptical that lobby briefings as reported are a true reflection of the exchanges, as can be seen from the White House press briefings, what is said is available for anyone to view impartially without media bias.

attributes.action: I want a Royal Commision to examine the Obesity Crisis in the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: UK obesity dates from the almost total collapse of the once World leading UK pottery industry in Stoke on Trent. A typical plate increased from 9.5 inches to 11 inches dia. That holds 40% more nosh & we led a much more active life; no Ipads and stuff then!

attributes.action: Ban the sale of over the counter codeine based pain killers
attributes.background: Codeine is a drug that is sold without prescription in the UK. It is used by drug addicted in order to “get high” in big dosage, which is equal to what’s contained in one pack (30 tablets). It is banned for opened sale in US, Germany, Japan and Australia.

attributes.action: Ban vans parking and blocking views of crossings&driveways
attributes.background: Van drivers don’t realise that parking where they do can cause view of drivers pulling off of driveways and people waiting to cross and bus stops etc

attributes.action: Scrap or Re-evaluate Hazard Perception
attributes.background:
The 'hazard perception' part of UK theory tests is one of the most hated parts of becoming a learner driver. 
The hazard perception part is taken on a computer, where you click the screen when you see a developing hazard.
attributes.additional_details:
The problem with this part of the theory test is that you have to spot 'developing hazards', and if you spot a hazard 'too early' you do not get the marks. Put this into real life, spotting a hazard too early? The entire marking scheme is pathetic. 
I do not disagree with the idea however, as spotting hazards is essential for safe driving. The hazard perception should be incorporated in the practical test and marked by an examiner, someone able to think, and not a computer.

attributes.action: Replace credit card commission to businesses with flat fees per transaction
attributes.background: The government announced recently that businesses are no longer able to charge commission on credit card payments. However, credit card companies can still levy commission on businesses. This is damaging to many businesses, especially as commissions vary, so we must introduce fixed fees instead.
attributes.additional_details:
More people will use a credit card rather than a debit card now there is no commission to pay. This is to be expected, after all, the money is better in their account for a month, but the cost to business is unjust.
The cost for debit card transactions is around 15p per transaction. 
For £100,000 worth of transactions at an average of £50, this would equate to £300. 
For credit cards this could be between £1,500 and £2,000. There is no justification for such excess so please help to stop it.

attributes.action: Referenda enacted by a UK nation must allow citizens born in that nation a vote.
attributes.background: If a UK nation considers a referendum about independence from the union, or a related topic that affects the stability of that union, then voters born in that nation, and who are citizens of the UK residing within the UK, must be able to vote on the referendum topic.
attributes.additional_details:
The Scottish Independence Referendum of 2014 refused the vote to citizens of the UK born in Scotland, but who resided in another nation of the UK. Since this would likely impact their citizenship (stateless?) and ability to work, they should be able to vote.

This is a general petition, and is not specific to a future Scottish Referendum. Any citizen of the UK, born in a UK nation (Northern Ireland, Wales, Scotland, England) where their birth-Nation has a referendum, should be able to vote.

attributes.action: Add American Football to the curriculum
attributes.background: Although American Football is not common in the U.K. Just yet, it is growing into interest to many people. However many people are restricted from playing it as there are very few clubs and no schools I know of includes American Football in there education.
attributes.additional_details: There are many benefits of playing American Football. The best thing about American Football is that anyone and everyone can play it as size doesn't matter. In fact being slightly overweight or being skinny can actually benefit to many people's attention. Many people think that American Football is a very rough sport but this is not true. You have contact American Football and you have Flag American Football meaning that if you play the flagged version there will be no contact meaning no harm

attributes.action: Make all companies share their maternity and paternity leave policies publically
attributes.background: Many companies provide maternity leave pay above the statutory minimum and increasing numbers also offer enhanced paternity pay. These can be invaluable for employees thinking about starting or growing their family but it's often a benefit you can't find out about when you sign up for a new job.
attributes.additional_details:
Making these policies publically available would help working parents make an informed choice about which companies they want to work for and help to celebrate the companies which are the most family friendly. It would also start to bring some parity to an area of benefits which at the moment varys widely from a couple of weeks full pay to a whole year. 

Having a child is one of life's most expensive adventures and choosing an employer who supports this shouldn't be left to chance or hearsay.

attributes.action: The UK to urge the UN to add Catalonia as a non-self-governing territory.
attributes.background: The UN charter defines a Non-Self-Governing Territory (NSGT) as one “whose people have not yet attained a full measure of self-government”. Given the recent actions of the Spanish regime, as permanent member of the UNSC the UK should urge that Catalonia be added to the NSGT list maintained by the UN
attributes.additional_details: Catalonia has a unique language, culture and ethnicity. Between 1930 and 1970 Spain as a state committed various violent repressions on the Catalonians and restricted their culture, language and identity. The Spanish terrorists who did this were formally pardoned by Madrid. Currently the Catalonians are expressing their right to self-determination through a peaceful referendum, which has been violently banned by the Spanish regime.

attributes.action: Make the uk armed forces pensions tax free.
attributes.background: The current U.K. Armed forces pensions, is taxable, other services are non taxable, this should be addressed and made fair across the public sector.

attributes.action: Add Lichen sclerosus to the Medical Exemption list
attributes.background: To obtain a Medical Exemption Certificate and get free NHS prescriptions a condition needs to be on the current Medical Exemption list. I feel this list does not go far enough to help those suffering with long-term conditions such as Lichen Sclerosus. A revision could help thousands of people.

attributes.action: refund 2 months Road tax for every car driver, due to the amount of pot holes
attributes.background: We are paying road tax for roads that are not fit for us to drive on and this is causing damage to our vehicles and the cost lies with us the tax payer to repair our cars. if you are paying for a service the service that you are paying for sure be suitable and not value for money.
attributes.additional_details:
In order to address this situation I believe that the government should reduce the amount of road tax for next year as compensation or give back the equivalent of two months road tax to every car owner in the country.

If you paid for any of the service that wasn't fit for purpose you will be able to claim a refund why is this not the same with our Road tax

attributes.action: Require drivers aged 70 + to undergo an annual road safety check and eye exam.
attributes.background: I propose that all drivers aged 70 and over should have to have annual safety assessment by a qualified driving instructor, and an eye examination by an optometrist, both of whom will submit a report to the DVLA to allow them to hold their license for the following twelve months.

attributes.action: Cap council tax at 2% per annum maximum from 2019 onwards
attributes.background:
Many pensioners and early retirees have fixed incomes (annuity pensions).
The last two years have seen an 11% increase in council tax which is proving increasingly difficult to pay.
